title: Demonstrating Attention
content: Active listening requires visible engagement. Make eye contact (when culturally appropriate). Face the speaker. Avoid distracting behaviors. Provide verbal acknowledgments. These signals encourage complete information sharing. When speakers see attention, they communicate more thoroughly.

mcq.question: A colleague approaches with information while you're focused on a task. What's the best response?

options.B: Tell them to come back later
options.C: Stop, face them, and give full attention
options.D: Listen while finishing your current action

mcq.explanation: Divided attention means degraded listening. Either the task or the listening will suffer. Stop, listen fully, then return to the task. If truly urgent, briefly explain and schedule immediate follow-up.

openQuestions: What behaviors signal to others that you're actively listening?
How do you handle interruptions when you're focused on a critical task?
